subject: Fashion
title: Non-Binary Fashion Language
description: A micro-lesson that makes Non-Binary Fashion Language usable.

hook.text: Fashion has always used 'menswear' and 'womenswear.' There's no standard third category yet.

buildup.text: Brands experiment with terms like 'All,' 'Human,' or simply dropping gender labels entirely.

discovery.text: Pronouns on name tags at fashion events became common after 2019. Language started catching up.

twist.text: Sizing is the real problem. Without gendered sizing, how do you fit 8 billion different bodies?

climax.text: Non-binary fashion needs more than new words. It needs an entirely new system of making clothes.

punchline.text: New labels are easy. New patterns are the revolution.

quiz.question: What is the biggest practical challenge for non-binary fashion?
options: Creating new marketing language for advertising campaigns
Developing sizing systems that work without gendered categories
Convincing consumers to shop outside traditional departments
